articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Renewable energy's share of German power mix rose to 46% last year: research group
articles.description: Renewable energy's share of Germany's overall power supply mix rose by 5.4 percentage points last year to 46%, data from Europe's biggest state-funded research and development service showed.
articles.content:
FRANKFURT (Reuters) - Renewable energy’s share of Germany’s overall power supply mix rose by 5.4 percentage points last year to 46%, data from Europe’s biggest state-funded research and development service showed. 
Europe’s biggest economy is aiming for rene… [+2137 chars]

articles.author: Colm Fulton
articles.title: Climate strike but no cake for Greta Thunberg as she turns 17
articles.description: "I'm not the kind of person who celebrates birthdays," Greta Thunberg said as she turned 17 on Friday, marking the occasion in inimitable style - with a seven-hour hour protest outside the Swedish parliament.
articles.content:
STOCKHOLM (Reuters) - “I’m not the kind of person who celebrates birthdays,” Greta Thunberg said as she turned 17 on Friday, marking the occasion in inimitable style - with a seven-hour hour protest outside the Swedish parliament. 
The climate activist brave… [+1002 chars]

articles.author: Shreyashi Sanyal
articles.title: EMERGING MARKETS-Chilean, Mexican pesos hit 2-week lows as Middle East tensions grip
articles.description:
The Chilean and Mexican pesos slid to
two-week lows against the dollar as investors turned risk averse
after a U.S. air strike in Iraq killed a top Iranian commander,
causing tensions to flare in the Middle East. 
    Major-General Qassem Soleimani, head of I…

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: December U.S. factory activity the weakest in a decade - ISM
articles.description: The U.S. manufacturing sector contracted in December by the most in more than a decade with order volumes crashing to near an 11-year low and factory employment falling for a fifth straight month, according to an industry report released on Friday.
articles.content: (Reuters) - The U.S. manufacturing sector contracted in December by the most in more than a decade with order volumes crashing to near an 11-year low and factory employment falling for a fifth straight month, according to an industry report released on Friday… [+1543 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: U.S. construction spending rises, boosted by housing sector
articles.description: U.S. construction spending rose more than expected in November and builders also spent more in earlier months than previously estimated, a sign the housing sector was giving some support to economic growth.
articles.content:
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. construction spending rose more than expected in November and builders also spent more in earlier months than previously estimated, a sign the housing sector was giving some support to economic growth.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: U.N. Secretary General concerned by recent escalation in the Gulf, calls for maximum restraint
articles.description: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres is deeply concerned by the recent rise in tensions in the Middle East, where the United States killed top Iranian commander Qassem Soleimani following violent protests at its embassy in Baghdad.
articles.content: UNITED NATIONS (Reuters) - United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres is deeply concerned by the recent rise in tensions in the Middle East, where the United States killed top Iranian commander Qassem Soleimani following violent protests at its embassy… [+398 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: CANADA STOCKS-TSX slips after U.S. air strike in Baghdad
articles.description: Canada's main stock index fell on Friday after a U.S. air strike in Baghdad killed a top Iranian commander, sharply escalating geopolitical tensions in the Middle East, but a jump in shares of energy companies limited losses.
articles.content:
Jan 3 (Reuters) - Canada’s main stock index fell on Friday after a U.S. air strike in Baghdad killed a top Iranian commander, sharply escalating geopolitical tensions in the Middle East, but a jump in shares of energy companies limited losses.
